items.text: Hetmyer's lived by the sword and dies by it back of a length, quick ball, Hetmyer wanted to flick it off his pads, but it just gets a top edge that flies to square leg for a simple catch. The dropped catch by Imrul hasn't cost Bangladesh much
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, OUT

dismissal.text: SO Hetmyer c sub (Nazmul Islam) b Rubel Hossain 14 (10b 0x4 1x6) SR: 140.00

items.preText: The captain's in, Rovman Powell. They need a partnership now, but can't afford to dawdle too much with the required rate rising
items.text: drifting on the pads, length ball, turned to deep square leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Powell, 1 run

items.text: back of a length, punched firmly to cover, where Mahmudullah dives to his left and stops the ball
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: coming back into the batsman, who turns it off his pads to short fine leg. Quick single taken
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: popped it straight to mid-on not quite full enough for the drive, he stayed in his crease and tried to hit on the up, ends up spooning a simple catch to mid-on. He won't like watching replays of that. Soft dismissal and at the most inopportune time for his team
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Powell, OUT

dismissal.text: R Powell c Soumya Sarkar b Mashrafe Mortaza 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

items.preText: Anon06: "Samuels batting at 5 would also force him to put some urgency in his batting. Either him or Bravo can be at 5. Both are slow starters and get bogged down, but both can be explosive when required. Just need some momentum or be forced to play that way."
items.text: length ball on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.preText: Firoz: "First 100 balls of the innings WI scored 70 runs for 2 wickets. Next 100 deliveries they made 86 for 2 wickets. They need 100 runs off 100 balls with 6 wickets remaining. Easy?"
items.text: strays too far down leg and Mushfiqur couldn't get a glove to it, tumbling to his left. Two wides
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, 2 wides

items.text: back of a length outside off, punched to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.preText:
Mehidy is back

Syed Kabir: "Looks like Rubel and Bangladesh have figured out a plan for Hetmyer. He almost got out to a leg side flick a few overs back and now gets out to a similar shot. "
items.text: full ball outside off, driven but cover intercepts
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, no run

items.text: goes straighter that time, and Chase is able to tickle it very fine. They run hard and get three
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 3 runs

items.text: flatter on the stumps, he stays in his crease and swipes across the line to deep midwicket. They run two again, and Mushfiqur isn't happy with Rubel's fielding effort running from square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 2 runs

items.text: well timed slog sweep bisects deep square leg and deep midwicket. Kept the ball flat and hard, it pings into the fence
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: goes deep in his crease to flick this to deep square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: fuller ball on off, tapped to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 1 run

items.preText: Abuzoya: "This pair is the last Hope for WI to Chase this target"
items.text: back of a length on off, slower ball, tapped to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: back of a length, only 115 clicks, nipping back into the batsman who tries to work it away and misses. The ball hits him and rolls away
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: fuller ball outside off, tentatively blocked into the off side. Hope wants the strike, but Chase turns down the risky single
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: mix up but he's safe this time Chase wanted the single, having tapped this past the bowler, but Hope was stuck to his crease and had his hand up. Chase took a few steps down, hurriedly turned back. The throw was very wide of the stumps, which gave him enough time to get back
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, he stays on the back foot and cuts it past point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, 1 run

items.text: back of a length again outside off, he flat bats it to mid-off for a quick single
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.preText:
The Fizz is back

Lots of puns on 'Hope' coming in, as expected. I'll publish the most witty ones...
items.text: angling across, back of a length, he stays in his crease and slaps it past cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: mid-off coming in from long-off. Will Chase take the temptation to go over the top? There's a slip coming in too
items.text: he stays still and steers this fuller ball that's angled across to third man
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Chase, 1 run

items.text: great timing back of a length angling across, and Hope strokes it through cover off the back foot. Beats a despairing dive by the man running in from deep point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: fuller ball, dug out to midwicket
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: stays back to whip this across the line to deep midwicket. Short ball on the stumps that didn't rise very high
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run
